qas.question: Which city did Baden, Württemberg-Baden, and Württemberg-Hohenzollern merge into?

When did the German reunification take place?

answers.text: failed to reach the necessary majority vote in Brandenburg

plausible_answers.text: to merge Berlin with surrounding Brandenburg as "Berlin-Brandenburg"

qas.question: What did a majority of Berliners vote for in 1957?

plausible_answers.text: failed to reach the necessary majority vote

qas.question: What happened to the referendum in 1990 to merge East Berlin with Saxony?

When did Saarland leave the Federal Republic?

context: In <a1_0><b13_0>1952<b13_0/><a1_0/>, following a referendum, <b5_0>Baden, Württemberg-Baden, and <b10_0>Württemberg-Hohenzollern<b5_0/> merged into <a0_0>Baden-Württemberg<b10_0/><a0_0/>. <b11_0>In 1957<b11_0/>, the Saar Protectorate rejoined <b9_0>the Federal Republic<b9_0/> as the <a2_0>Saarland<a2_0/>. German reunification in <a3_0><b8_0>1990<b8_0/><a3_0/>, in which the German Democratic Republic (East <b14_0>Germany<b14_0/>) ascended into the Federal Republic, resulted in the addition of the re-established eastern states of Brandenburg, Mecklenburg-West Pomerania (in German Mecklenburg-Vorpommern), Saxony (Sachsen), Saxony-Anhalt (Sachsen-Anhalt), and Thuringia (Thüringen), as well as the reunification of <b12_0>West and East Berlin<b12_0/> into Berlin and its establishment as a full and equal state. A regional referendum in 1996 <b6_0>to merge Berlin with surrounding Brandenburg as "Berlin-Brandenburg"<b6_0/> <a4_0><b7_0>failed to reach the necessary majority vote<b7_0/> in Brandenburg<a4_0/>, while a majority of Berliners voted in favour of the merger.
